text: I went to college in Boston and it was
at a time when there were revival houses
all over the city and I saw three women
at a revival house Robert Altman's three
women and I'd never really had kind of
gone to the movies all my life and
really liked movies but I never really
noticed the presence of a director
before which is kind of a terrible thing
to say but you know I just I didn't
think of movies that way and for the for
the first time I thought who was that
you know who made that movie um and I
thought that's what I want to do for
some reason awful lot of actors come
from kind of these peripatetic
backgrounds um you know
army kids and missionary kids and kids
of salesmen and IBM that kind of thing
you'll always find that they've had
these kind of itinerant childhoods and
the only thing I can think of is that it
just teaches you that behavior is not
concrete I think a lot of people think
that that that how you behave is given
all that behavior is character you know
so they think like well I am I act this
way therefore I am this way and and and
one of the things that you learn moving
around a lot is that you know behavior
is mutable and that's something that
actors know obviously we know inherently
is that you know the behavior means
different things but you change it
depending on where you are who you are
what you want to accomplish that's what
you learn very quickly is that you go to
I would go to one school and everybody
would dance one way so you'd go to the
new school and you go when you'd go to
the school dance you look at the gym and
you'd notice that no one picked up their
feet at that school that they just
shuffled their feet when they dance
you're like okay so that's the way you
dance here so once again you learn
there's no one way to do anything it
just depends on where you are it depends
on what the rules of that community are
I was an excellent waitress I'm very
impatient with people who tell me that
they're not even people say that they're
not
I'm good at waiting tables I'm like
we're just not paying attention on the
soap opera I was both a good girl and a

of a tragic day because as the world
turns was canceled yesterday but that
was a show that I was on and I played
Franny who was the chief of staff of the
hospital starter so she had been born on
the show and she was the quintessential
good girl so I did that for a while and
then they created the role of my my evil
kind of selfish really half sister slash
cousin we had the same father but our
mothers were sisters so it was a kind of
a convoluted relationship the person who
cast me in the dresser my very first
director said you know you should be
aware that because you have red hair if
somebody casts you they'll they'll be
casting you for a reason and there'll be
things that you won't get because you
know visually especially on stage you
know people can see you
but people have rarely suggested that I
dye it
I've been wigged in things plenty of
times but the funny thing about it is
that even when I have a different hair
color when I have died at up on occasion
or I've worn wigs people tend to still
remember me as having red hair even when
I didn't in the film I actually first
met Tom Ford in 1998 right after my son
was born my son was born in 1997 and Tom
what made a drum made a dress for those
Oscars the first time I was nominated
for Boogie Nights he made a really
beautiful black dress that was chiffon
and kind of had an empire waist and
because I just had a baby my boobs were
really big and I just didn't feel
confident enough to wear it so and that
was the other thing about him too he was
incredibly gracious he was like it's a
dress I don't care you know where it
don't wear it but keep it you know I
think I still have it actually somewhere
for a single man I I wasn't thinking
about anybody in particular I wasn't
thinking about Ann Margaret even though
people have mentioned her to me I was
thinking about a particular kind of
woman she's someone who is very wealthy
and very
educated and and kind of a party girl I

is that's kind of where I started I'd
love to do a musical um you know it's

secret parts of my personality that I I
love musical theater we love all the
high school musicals too hairspray I
have to say hairspray is genius what

portray the human condition and and
sometimes we don't wear clothes you know
people always ask that thing about
families and children and nudity and I
always say well my children don't watch
my movie people people will ask me what
movies of yours to your children like
and I'm like none of them because they
don't watch my movies because number one
they're not interested in and and number
two they're not movies for children so
they they wouldn't be seeing them I make
these jokes about how my you know my
metier is all is tragedy um
but it's not for I don't know not for
